Normalize numeric vector

Source: R/utils.R
normalization.Rd

Normalize numeric vector

Usage

normalization(x, method = "max_min", na_rm = TRUE, ...)

Arguments

x

Input numeric vector.

method

Method used for normalization.

na_rm

Whether to remove NA values, and if setting TRUE, using 0 instead.

...

Parameters for other methods.

Value

Normalized numeric vector

Examples

nums <- c(runif(2), NA, -runif(2))
nums
#> [1]  0.3972882  0.2978815         NA -0.9023833 -0.5922850
normalization(nums, method = "max_min")
#> [1] 1.0000000 0.9235140 0.6943164 0.0000000 0.2385974
normalization(nums, method = "maximum")
#> [1]  0.4402655  0.3301053  0.0000000 -1.0000000 -0.6563564
normalization(nums, method = "sum")
#> [1]  0.1814235  0.1360290  0.0000000 -0.4120776 -0.2704698
normalization(nums, method = "softmax")
#> [1] 0.38310927 0.32145407 0.19000595 0.03863786 0.06679284
normalization(nums, method = "z_score")
#> [1]  0.9835085  0.8080429  0.2822436 -1.3105792 -0.7632158
normalization(nums, method = "mad")
#> [1]  0.6744908  0.5057244  0.0000000 -1.5320092 -1.0055441
normalization(nums, method = "unit_vector")
#> [1]  0.3343792  0.2507132  0.0000000 -0.7594946 -0.4984991
normalization(nums, method = "unit_vector", na_rm = FALSE)
#> [1]  0.3343792  0.2507132         NA -0.7594946 -0.4984991
